CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 3, 1965, pg. 1, reads: "Children's 'Playground' - This stench-filled heaping of all kinds of refuse, perishable or not, lurks only a few feet off Centre Ave., 1900 block. At least one family of ill-housed, ill-fed children, age 4 to 9, must pass through this horror of untidiness, day after day - as if it were a front yard - leading to the avenue.  'Winos' dearly love such surroundings, in which to fondle and empty their 'fifths.'  This is the Hill 'jungle,' at its worst. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Six men, including man in plaid vest, standing before pile of trash, with three garbage cans in foreground, and dented box inscribed "Canned Salmon," Hill District
